pullRequest.body:
The main result is well-known. Let `S` be a closed subalgebra of a Banach algebra `A`. If `x : S`, then the spectrum of `x` (in `S`) is the spectrum of `↑x : A` (in `A`) along with whichever, necessarily bounded, components of the complement (of the `A` spectrum) it happens to intersect.

Along the way we prove a few other useful results. For example, the boundary of the spectrum of `x` (in `S`) is a subset of the boundary of the spectrum of `↑x : A` (in `A`).

---

- [x] depends on: #14926 
- [x] depends on: #14927

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10374211993/job/28721140340)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10374211993/job/28721140658)

```suggestion
lemma Subalgebra.isUnit_of_isUnit_val_of_eventually {l : Filter S} {a : S}
    (ha : IsUnit (a : A)) (hla : l ≤ 𝓝 a) (hl : ∀ᶠ x in l, IsUnit x) (hl' : l.NeBot) :
```
We're already in the root namespace (but you probably want to put all of this in a `namespace Subalgebra` block).
This is actually there on purpose to avoid having the namespace open to avoid collisions.

```suggestion
/-- If `S` is a closed subalgebra of a Banach algebra `A`, then for any
`x : S`, the boundary of the spectrum of `x` relative to `S` is a subset of the spectrum of
`↑x : A` relative to `A`. -/
```
Since it's not literally of that type.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: results on the spectrum of elements in closed subalgebras of Banach algebras
